## Dataset Overview

### Project Context

The **Campus City Dataset** is a comprehensive, synthetic urban logistics dataset designed specifically for teaching computational optimization. It simulates a university campus and surrounding community, providing realistic but controlled data for optimization exercises across all course modules.

### Geographic Scope

- **Location**: Simulated urban university environment
- **Area**: 5 km² campus and surrounding community  
- **Population**: 25,000 students + 15,000 residents
- **Time Scale**: 240 operational days (academic year)

###  Transportation Cost Structure

| Cost Component | Value | Description |
|---------------|-------|-------------|
| Base Rate | $1.50 per unit-km | Variable cost based on distance |
| Fixed Cost | $3.00 per shipment | Loading/unloading fixed cost |
| Minimum Cost | $2.00 per unit | Regardless of distance |
| Calculation Method | Haversine formula | Geographic distance accuracy |

## Technical Implementation

### Module-Specific Data Subsets

#### Module 1: Linear Programming (Weeks 1-4)

| Component | Selection | Constraints | Complexity |
|-----------|-----------|-------------|------------|
| Facilities | 6 (MED_CENTER, ENG_BUILDING, SCIENCE_HALL, DORM_A, LIBRARY, COMM_CENTER) | Basic capacity | Linear |
| Warehouses | 3 (WH_NORTH, WH_SOUTH, WH_EAST) | Budget: $800,000 | Single period |
| Costs | Linear transportation | Demand satisfaction | Basic LP |

#### Module 2: Nonlinear Optimization (Weeks 4-7)

| Component | Selection | Constraints | Complexity |
|-----------|-----------|-------------|------------|
| Facilities | 10 (all except stadium and specialized) | Nonlinear costs | Multi-period |
| Warehouses | 4 (all except WH_WEST) | KKT conditions | Environmental |
| Costs | Enhanced models | Capacity limits | Advanced NLP |

#### Module 3: Graph Algorithms (Weeks 7-9)

| Component | Selection | Constraints | Complexity |
|-----------|-----------|-------------|------------|
| Facilities | 12 (all core facilities) | Routing constraints | Network flows |
| Warehouses | 5 (complete set) | Network optimization | Combinatorial |
| Costs | Full matrix | Graph-based | System integration |

### Data Validation & Feasibility

| Metric | Value | Status |
|--------|-------|--------|
| Total Daily Demand | 485 units | ✅ Within capacity |
| Total Warehouse Capacity | 2000 units | ✅ Sufficient |
| Capacity Utilization | 24.25% | ✅ Optimal range |
| Budget Headroom | 35% above estimated | ✅ Feasible |
| Network Connectivity | All locations connected | ✅ Accessible |

| matplotlib | Static visualizations | pip install matplotlib |

### Basic Usage Examples

#### Data Access Commands

- Initialize dataset: CampusCityDataset()
- Get module-specific data: get_module_subset(module_number)
- Access facility demands: dataset.demands[facility_id]
- Calculate transportation costs: dataset.cost_matrix[from_warehouse, to_facility]


```python
# 1. Create dataset with feasible constraints
print("1. Creating dataset with guaranteed feasible constraints...")
dataset = FeasibleCampusDataset()


# 2. Solve optimization problem
print("2. Solving Module 1 optimization problem...")
optimizer = FeasibleCampusOptimizer(campus_data)
solution = optimizer.build_and_solve_module1()
# 3. Print detailed solution
    optimizer.print_detailed_solution()
```
